intro: Inversodicraea tenuissima, commonly known as the slender inversodicraea, is a rare and small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and white to pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
